item.title: Scattered Spider hackers shift focus to aviation, transportation firms
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Hackers associated with Scattered Spider tactics have expanded their targeting to the aviation and transportation industries after previously attacking insurance and retail sectors [...]

item.title: Russia’s throttling of Cloudflare makes sites inaccessible
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Starting June 9, 2025, Russian internet service providers (ISPs) have begun throttling access to websites and services protected by Cloudflare, an American internet giant. [...]

item.title: Citrix Bleed 2 flaw now believed to be exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A critical NetScaler ADC and Gateway vulnerability dubbed "Citrix Bleed 2" (CVE-2025-5777) is now likely exploited in attacks, according to cybersecurity firm ReliaQuest, seeing an increase in suspicious sessions on Citrix devices. [...]

item.title: Retail giant Ahold Delhaize says data breach affects 2.2 million people
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Ahold Delhaize, one of the world's largest food retail chains, is notifying over 2.2 million individuals that their personal, financial, and health information was stolen in a November ransomware attack that impacted its U.S. systems. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5060829 update released with 38 new changes, fixes
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​​Microsoft has released the KB5060829 preview cumulative update for Windows 11 24H2, which includes 38 changes, including improvements to the taskbar and a new PC-to-PC migration experience. [...]

item.title: Whole Foods supplier UNFI restores core systems after cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: American grocery wholesale giant United Natural Foods (UNFI) reports that it has restored its core systems and brought online the electronic ordering and invoicing systems affected by a cyberattack. [...]

item.title: Hawaiian Airlines discloses cyberattack, flights not affected
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Hawaiian Airlines, the tenth-largest commercial airline in the United States, is investigating a cyberattack that has disrupted access to some of its systems. [...]

item.title: FTC approves $126 million in Fortnite refunds over ‘dark patterns’
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has approved $126,000,000 in refunds to be sent to 969,173 Fortnite players as part of a settlement over allegations that Epic Games tricked users into making unwanted purchases. [...]

item.title: Brother printer bug in 689 models exposes default admin passwords
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A total of 689 printer models from Brother, along with 53 other models from Fujifilm, Toshiba, and Konica Minolta, come with a default administrator password that remote attackers can generate. Even worse, there is no way to fix the flaw via firmware in existing printers. [...]

item.title: Ex-student charged over hacking university for cheap parking, data breaches
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: New South Wales police in Australia have arrested a 27-year-old former Western Sydney University (WSU) student for allegedly hacking into the University's systems on multiple occasions, starting with a scheme to obtain cheaper parking. [...]

item.title: Cisco warns of max severity RCE flaws in Identity Services Engine
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Cisco has published a bulletin to warn about two critical, unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities affecting Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) and the Passive Identity Connector (ISE-PIC). [...]

item.title: Man pleads guilty to hacking networks to pitch security services
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: A Kansas City man has pleaded guilty to hacking multiple organizations to advertise his cybersecurity services, the U.S. Department of Justice announced on Wednesday. [...]

item.title: 3 key takeaways from the Scattered Spider attacks on insurance firms
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Push Security
item.description: Scattered Spider recently pivoted from targeting worldwide retailers to U.S. based insurance firms, with no signs of slowing down. Learn about Scattered Spider TTPs and how to defend your organization against MFA bypass, help desk scams, and more. [...]
